block.p: After narrowing through the 1980's, the gap between test scores of black and white students widened again between 1990 and 1999, according to national test scores released in a federal report.
The results showed that the average black 17-year-old reads only about as well as the average white 13-year-old. Most puzzling, the gap remains widest among children of the best-educated parents.

Officials have little explanation, but suggested that solutions might lie in the examples of some cities that have closed the gap. Those cities have introduced smaller classes and require all students to take rigorous courses.
